text: Gex () is a commune in the Ain department. It is in the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes in east France. Gex is the capital of the arrondissement of Gex and of the historical region Pays de Gex. It is from the Swiss border and from Geneva. ==Geography== The area of Gex is . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Gex to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Lyon, the regional capital - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Strasbourg - ; * Nantes - ; * Marseille - . Gex and its neighboring communes ===Climate=== The climate of Gex, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Gex are known, in French, as Gexois (women: Gexoises'). Gex's population, in 2014 was 11,141 and its population density is of inhabitants/km2. It is also the capital of the canton of Gex, formed by 7 communes (29,557 inhabitants) (2014) It is part of the intercommunality Pays de Gex. == Gallery == File:Church of Gex in the early morningsun - panoramio.jpg|Church of Gex. File:Bleu de Gex.jpg|Bleu de Gex cheese. ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Gex * Communes of the Ain department ==References== Category:Subprefectures in France Category:Communes in Ain
